definition: to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense
row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column

sentences.english: Procuratorial authority has the administrative power and double judicial powers attribute.
sentences.chinese: 检察权具有行政权和司法权的双重属性。

sentences.english: In India"s parliamentary system, the executive is subordinate to the legislature.
sentences.chinese: 在印度的议会制度中，立法权高于行政权。

sentences.english: Executive authority is vested in a Governor, popularly elected for a four-year term.
sentences.chinese: 行政权被授予了一位被选举的行政长官，任期为四年。

sentences.english: Cambodia is now a constitutional monarchy where executive power is held by the prime minister.
sentences.chinese: 柬埔寨现在是一个君主立宪制国家，首相行使行政权。

sentences.english: Only a person with administrative rights can backdate a Transaction.
sentences.chinese: 只有具有行政权的人才可以将交易倒填日期。

sentences.english: Then plotting the purview of the power of Fabu and Daliyuan, separate the judicial administrative authority with the judiciary power.
sentences.chinese: 第二步是明确部院权限，将司法行政权与审判权分开。

definition: separation of powers for checks and balances
property ownership or right/financial power/financial control
centralized power (history), e.g. under an Emperor or party
